009
010package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters;
011
012import imagingbook.lib.filters.GenericFilter;
013import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ImageAccessor;
014import imagingbook.lib.image.access.ScalarAccessor;
015import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic;
016import imagingbook.lib.math.VectorNorm;
017import imagingbook.lib.math.VectorNorm.NormType;
018
019/**
020 * This class implements a bilateral filter as proposed in
021 * C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images",
022 * Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision,
023 * Bombay, India.
024 * The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all 
025 * image types.
026 * @author W. Burger
027 * @version 2013/05/30
028 */
029public class BilateralFilter extends GenericFilter {
030        
031        public static class Parameters {
032                /** Sigma (width) of domain filter */
033                public double sigmaD = 2;               
034                /** Sigma (width) of range filter */
035                public double sigmaR = 50;
036                /** Specify which distance norm to use */
037                public NormType colorNormType = NormType.L2;
038                
039                /**
040                 * Create a default parameter object.
041                 * @param sigmaD Sigma (width) of domain filter
042                 * @param sigmaR Sigma (width) of range filter
043                 * @return a new parameter object
044                 */
045                static Parameters create(double sigmaD, double sigmaR) {
046                        Parameters p = new Parameters();
047                        p.sigmaD = sigmaD;
048                        p.sigmaR = sigmaR;
049                        return p;
050                }
051        }
052        
053        protected final Parameters params;
054        
055        private float[][] Hd;   // the domain kernel
056        protected final int K;
057        protected final float[] rgb = {0,0,0};
058        protected final double sigmaR2;
059        protected final VectorNorm colorNorm;
060        protected final double colorScale;
061        
062        public BilateralFilter() {
063                this(new Parameters());
064        }
065        
066        // only for convenience / book compatibility:
067        public BilateralFilter(double sigmaD, double sigmaR) {
068                this(Parameters.create(sigmaD, sigmaR));
069        }
070        
071        public BilateralFilter(Parameters params) {
072                this.params = params;
073                K = (int) Math.max(1, 3.5 * params.sigmaD);
074                sigmaR2 = params.sigmaR * params.sigmaR;
075                colorNorm = params.colorNormType.create();
076                colorScale = Arithmetic.sqr(colorNorm.getScale(3));
077                initialize();
078        }
079        
080        private void initialize() {
081                Hd = makeDomainKernel2D(params.sigmaD, K);
082        }
083        
084        @Override
085        public float filterScalar(ScalarAccessor I, int u, int v) {
086                float S = 0;                    // sum of weighted pixel values
087                float W = 0;                    // sum of weights
088                
089                float a = I.getVal(u, v); // value of the current center pixel
090                
091                for (int m = -K; m <= K; m++) {
092                        for (int n = -K; n <= K; n++) {
093                                float b = I.getVal(u + m, v + n);
094                                float wd = Hd[m + K][n + K];
095                                float wr = similarityGauss(a, b);
096                                float w = wd * wr;
097                                S = S + w * b;
098                                W = W + w;
099                        }
100                }
101                return S / W;
102        }
103        
104        @Override
105        public float[] filterVector(ImageAccessor I, int u, int v) {
106                float[] S = new float[3];       // sum of weighted RGB values
107                float W = 0;                            // sum of weights
108                //int[] a = new int[3];
109                //int[] b = new int[3];
110                
111                float[] a = I.getPix(u, v);                     // value of the current center pixel
112                
113                for (int m = -K; m <= K; m++) {
114                        for (int n = -K; n <= K; n++) {
115                                float[] b = I.getPix(u + m, v + n);
116                                float wd = Hd[m + K][n + K];
117                                float wr = similarityGauss(a, b);
118                                float w = wd * wr;
119                                S[0] = S[0] + w * b[0];
120                                S[1] = S[1] + w * b[1];
121                                S[2] = S[2] + w * b[2];
122                                W = W + w;
123                        }
124                }
125                rgb[0] = Math.round(S[0] / W);
126                rgb[1] = Math.round(S[1] / W);
127                rgb[2] = Math.round(S[2] / W);
128                return rgb;
129        }
130        
131        // ------------------------------------------------------
132        // This returns the weights for a Gaussian range kernel (scalar version):
133        protected float similarityGauss(float a, float b) {
134                double dI = a - b;
135                return (float) Math.exp(-(dI * dI) / (2 * sigmaR2));
136        }
137        
138        // This returns the weights for a Gaussian range kernel (color vector version):
139        protected float similarityGauss(float[] a, float[] b) {
140                double d2 = colorScale * colorNorm.distance2(a, b);
141                return (float) Math.exp(-d2 / (2 * sigmaR2));
142        }
143        
144        // Color distances need to be scaled to yield the same range of
145        // values. This method returns the scale factor for squared 
146        // distances, since this is what we use in the Gaussian.
147//      static double getColorDistanceScale(NormType norm) {
148//              double s = 1.0;
149//              switch (norm) {
150//              case L1 : s = 1/3.0; break;                             // L1-dist is in [0,...,3*255*3]
151//              case L2:  s = Math.sqrt(1/3.0); break;  // L2-dist is in [0,...,sqrt(3*255^2)] = [0,...,sqrt(3)*255]
152//              case Linf: s = 1.0; break;                              // Linf-dist is in [0,...,255]
153//              default: break;
154//              }
155//              return s * s;   // scale factor for the squared distance
156//      }
157
158        // ------------------------------------------------------
159
160        protected float[][] makeDomainKernel2D(double sigma, int K) {
161                int size = K + 1 + K;
162                float[][] domainKernel = new float[size][size]; //center cell = kernel[K][K]
163                double sigma2 = sigma * sigma;
164                double scale = 1.0 / (2 * Math.PI * sigma2);
165                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
166                        double x = K - i;
167                        for (int j = 0; j < size; j++) {
168                                double y = K - j;
169                                domainKernel[i][j] =  (float) (scale * Math.exp(-0.5 * (x*x + y*y) / sigma2));
170                        }
171                }
172                return domainKernel;
173        }
174        
175        protected float[] makeRangeKernel(double sigma, int K) {
176                int size = K + 1 + K;
177                float[] rangeKernel = new float[size]; //center cell = kernel[K]
178                double sigma2 = sigma * sigma;
179                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
180                        double x = K - i;
181                        rangeKernel[i] =  (float) Math.exp(-0.5 * (x*x) / sigma2);
182                }
183                return rangeKernel;
184        }
185
186}
